meanings.definition: Lack of warmth or friendliness; unfriendliness.
meanings.sent1: The inhospitality of the receptionist made me feel unwelcome.
meanings.sent2: The inn's inhospitality towards travelers was evident in their cold demeanor.
meanings.sent3: The inhospitality of the grumpy cat towards strangers was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The inhospitality of the storm clouds made everyone seek shelter.
meanings.sent5: The inhospitality of the desert sun was unbearable without shade.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being inhospitable.
meanings.sent1: The inhospitality of the environment made survival difficult.
meanings.sent2: The inhospitality of the terrain was evident in its harsh conditions.
meanings.sent3: The inhospitality of the weather made picnicking impossible.
meanings.sent4: The inhospitality of the mountain range was daunting to inexperienced climbers.
meanings.sent5: The inhospitality of the forest at night was unsettling to the campers.

meanings.definition: Unwelcoming or hostile behavior towards guests or visitors.
meanings.sent1: The inhospitality staff at the hotel made the guests feel unwelcome.
meanings.sent2: The inhospitality attitude of the host was off-putting to the visitors.
meanings.sent3: The inhospitality behavior of the guard towards tourists was quite rude.
meanings.sent4: The inhospitality treatment of the new neighbors was unexpected.
meanings.sent5: The inhospitality reception at the party dampened the mood for everyone.
